page.title: 05HOUSES AND WATER SUPPLY
page.content: About{50}houses are lived in all the year round by families in Lismore. Between{30}and 40 more are used regularly as{holiday homes. There are{10}houses let by the {District Council,}of which only half are occupied by people born in Lismore. Many{traditionally built cottages have been{improved}recently, with new roofs, kitchens and bathrooms, extra bedrooms, fitted carpets and now central heating.{Five new houses}are being built in{1985. { Water}is{hard}and comes to nearly all houses from their{own}springs.The one {public water supply}serves only{16 houses and the School. This year the quarry firm,{Yeoman of {Morven,}have kindly sent{drillers}to find water for people whose springs run dry in summer.
